data.title: Page 175 of 285
data.text:
Melbourne United are excited to announce the signing of star forward Scotty Hopson on a one-year deal.

Hopson starred for the New Zealand Breakers last season, often taking charge of games and helping the Breakers to a number of wins almost single-handedly. Hopson was rewarded with a spot in the All-NBL Second Team plus an MVP nomination. He averaged 19.1 points, 5.9 rebounds and 4.7 assists per game, shooting 47% from the field.

The 201cm Kentucky native has most recently been playing in the NBA G-League for Oklahoma City Blue, with the hopes of breaking into the NBA, but will return to the NBL with Melbourne United.

Joan Plaza is the new head coach of Coosur Real Betis.

The Spanish coach penned a deal for the season with an option for next one.

Gran Canaria signs Oliver Stevic.

Stevic averaged 7.7 points and 5.5 rebounds this season with Urbas Fuenlabrada.

Hapoel Jerusalem has brought in Lithuanian guard Edvinas Seskus for a two-week trial.

Seskus will most probably be registered in some of the club’s upcoming games, per Sports Rabbi.

Joan Plaza has reached an agreement to become the new head coach of Coosur Real Betis, according to Chema de Lucas.

Plaza, who has coached for eight years in the EuroLeague, will take over the Spanish team and replace Curro Segura, who was fired last week.

Spanish Liga ACB club RETAbet Bilbao Basket has officially announced the deal with Lithuanian big man Regimantas Miniotas.

Miniotas, 24, was off to a strong start to the season in the Lithuanian LKL with Prienai, averaging 18.5 points (3rd in the league), 10.5 rebounds (1st) and 24.5 PIR (1st).

Former West Virginia big man Sagaba Konate signed a contract with PAOK Thessaloniki of the Greek A1 league for the remainder of the 2020-21 season, the team announced.

Konate started the season in Spain where he appeared in six Liga ACB games for Casademont Zaragoza.

Thon Maker will try to fight for a spot in the Cleveland Cavaliers’ roster.

As reported by Mike Scotto the forward will be at the training camp with Cleveland.

The Beijing Royal Fighters have cut center Salah Mejri, according to the Chinese website Hupu.com.

The former NBA big man only appeared in two games with the Chinese team, averaging 2.5 points in 9.5 minutes.

Former Colgate forward Will Rayman has signed a contract with BG Göttingen in the German BBL, the team announced.

Rayman was off to a strong start to his rookie season in Estonia where he averaged over 23 points and 9 rebounds per game for Tartu Rock.

ACB side Bilbao Basket is expected to sign Lithuanian forward Regimantas Miniotas, as reported by newspaper El Correo.

Miniotas has averaged 18.4 points and 10.4 rebounds per game in 11 LKL games for Prienai this season.

Former Texas Tech and Arkansas guard Dusty Hannahs signed a contract with Kolossos Rhodes in Greece, the team announced. This will be his first experience in Europe as Hannahs has spent the first three seasons of his professional career in the NBA G League.

Hannahs is coming off a strong season with the Memphis Hustle in the G League where he averaged 21.4 points on 44.8 percent from deep. He was also called up to the NBA by the Grizzlies in February 2020.

Gabriel Deck could leave Real Madrid to go to NBA as reported by Marca.

Argentine forward will be free-agent next summer but would be willing to pay his escape to play in the Nba this season as his former teammates Facundo Campazzo.

Next week will be decisive: without a re-sign offer with Real Madrid Gabriel Deck could leave Spanish powerhouse.

Marco Belinelli has signed a three-year, €5 million contract with Virtus Bologna, as reported by La Gazzetta dello Sport.

The Italian guard is back in Italy after 13 years in the NBA where he won one ring with the Spurs.

Turkish BSL and EuroCup team Bahcesehir Koleji Istanbul has bought guard Shannon Evans out of his deal with Elan Bearnais Pau-Lacq-Orthez, the French team announced.

Evans was off to a strong start to the season in the French Jeep Elite as he was averaging 21.8 points and a league-leading 8.4 assists after five games.

Bahcesehir was on the market to find a new guard after Alex Perez was bought out by Fenerbahce.

Segafredo Virtus Bologna announced the rerturn of Marco Belinelli.

The veteran guard signed a contract until 30 June 2023.

Belinelli leaves the NBA after 13 years, with career averages of 9.7 points and 1.7 assists.

Last season he averaged 6.3 points per game for the San Antonio Spurs, the team with which he won the NBA title in the 2013/14 season.

According to gazzetta.it Marco Belinelli reached an agreement with Virtus Segafredo Bologna.

Belinelli was not satisfied with the offers received during the NBA Free Agency, and therefore decided to return to Italy.

The veteran guard started his career in the top italian divison with Virtus Bologna, debuting at just 16 years old.

Belinelli owns career-averages of 9.7 points and 1.7 assist in NBA.

He was the 18th pick of the 2007 NBA Draft.

Gravelines-Dunkerque announced the arrival of Khalid Boukichou.

The Belgian big man will replace the injured Itay Segev.

Last year Boukichou produced over 13 points and 5 rebounds per game for Spirou Charleroi.

Braian Angola signed with Ironi Ness Ziona until the end of the season.

The guard out of Florida State started the season with KK Partizan.

Last year Angola averaged 14 points, 5.2 rebounds, 2.8 assist and 1.9 steals per game in BCL with Telenet BC Oostende.

Joventut Badalona announced the contract extension of Simon Birgander till 2023.

The big man had already a deal through 2022.

Birgander is averaging 7.3 points and 3.7 rebounds per game in ACB this season.

Chalon announced the signing of playmaker Jordon Crawford for the 2020/2021 season.

The pointguard spent last season in Turkey, posting 16.4 points, 2.6 rebounds and 5.7 assists in 23 games played for Afyon.

Archie Goodwin signed a contract until the end of the season with Metropolitans 92.

The guard out of Kentucky (No.29 pick of the 2013 NBA Draft) spent last season between Turkey and Germany.

Unics Kazan announced the signing of Egor Koulechov.

The Russian-Israeli player comes from Ironi Nahariya and will play as a Russian in VTB League.

Le Mans Sarthe Basket announced the extension of coach Elric Delord and his assistant Antoine Mathieu until June 2023.

Delord took over the helm of the French team on 1 December 2019.

Joel Berry II signed a contract with Besiktas until the end of the season, the turkish team announced.

Last year the point guard out of UNC played in G League with the Greensboro Swarm (8ppg,2 apg).

Coosur Real Betis has parted ways with head coach Curro Segura.

The assistant coaches, Javier Carrasco and Antonio Pérez, will take over the team on a provisional basis.

The spanish team won just 2 of the 11 games played in ACB.

Frutti Extra Bursaspor has appointed Dusan Alimpijevic as head coach for the remaining of the season.

The Turkish team is winless in EuroCup and with only 3 wins in BSL so far.

Cliff Alexander signs with KT Sonic Boom.

The former NBA averaged 9.9 points and 4.6 rebounds last season with Le Mans in Jeep Elite.

Hapoel Holon announced the signing of Maxime De Zeeuw.

The Belgian forward will temporarily replace the injured Howell.

Walter Lemon jr is close to leaving Hapoel Tel Aviv, a source tells Sportando.

The Israeli team is on the market to replace him.

Lemon is averaging 15.5ppg in Balkan League.
